title: Mike Salmon (footballer)
text:
Michael Bernard Salmon (born 14 July 1964) is an English <a href="Association%20football">football</a> coach and former player.
Career.
Salmon played as a <a href="Goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a>, and in a career of 21 years, spent ten of them with <a href="Charlton%20Athletic%20F.C.">Charlton Athletic</a>. He began his career as a trainee with <a href="Blackburn%20Rovers%20F.C.">Blackburn Rovers</a>, making his debut in a 1-1 draw against Chelsea. He also gained experience early in his career with <a href="Chester%20City%20F.C.">Chester</a>, <a href="Stockport%20County%20F.C.">Stockport County</a>, <a href="Bolton%20Wanderers%20F.C.">Bolton Wanderers</a> and <a href="Wrexham%20A.F.C.">Wrexham</a> before joining the "Addicks" in 1989. In and out of the first team at Charlton over the years due to a number of injuries, he made 148 league appearances, before a serious cruciate ligament injury, sustained in January 1998 against <a href="Manchester%20City%20F.C.">Manchester City</a> at <a href="Maine%20Road">Maine Road</a>, put an end to his first-team career. A disastrous single game on loan at <a href="Oxford%20United%20F.C.">Oxford United</a> saw him concede seven goals. He finished his playing career at, then Premier League team <a href="Ipswich%20Town%20F.C.">Ipswich Town</a>, as the back up 'keeper to England goalkeeper <a href="Richard%20Wright%20%28footballer%29">Richard Wright</a>. He retired in 2002 having made around 500 first-team appearances and took up coaching.
Coaching career.
In 2002, he joined <a href="Arsenal%20F.C.">Arsenal</a> as goalkeeping coach. He also coached the 1st Team 'keepers at <a href="Gillingham%20F.C.">Gillingham</a> from 2002 to 2004. He remained with Arsenal until he emigrated to Canada with his family in 2007. He was the goalkeeper coach for <a href="Vancouver%20Whitecaps%20FC">Vancouver Whitecaps FC</a> in <a href="Major%20League%20Soccer">Major League Soccer</a> until 2011.
Salmon holds an <a href="The%20Football%20Association">English Football Association</a> Goalkeeping 'A' Licence and a <a href="UEFA">UEFA</a> 'A' Coaching Licence.
Honours.
Individual
